name: Moojig (Munkhtsogt) Battsogt
title: Full Stack Web Developer
summary: Motivated full stack web developer, dedicated to creating custom solutions for complex problems.

employment.title: Full Stack Engineer
description: Created new portal to the Federal Healthplan Marketplace at salusion.com/calculator.
Migrated the existing React front-end to use TypeScript to increase development ease and efficiency.
Originally began as a front-end engineer, but have taken complete responsibility over the back-end.

employment.title: Patient Service Coordinator
description: Managed patient appointments, insurance verification, customer service issues, and assisted doctors with examinations.

projects.title: ProjectKanri
description: A project management single page web application (SPA).

A user can create a project, create tasks associated with that project, invite other people to collaborate via email, restrict other members' edit and delete permissions, and assign them to different tasks. I was responsible for the database modelling and back-end user authentication and interaction with the client-side, and a few pages on the front-end.
Back-end tools: Node.js, Express.js, MongoDB/Mongoose. Front-end tools: React.js, Material UI.

projects.title: All For One
description: A server-rendered content aggregation website, similar in concept to Reddit.

You can sign up and see posts from your local area, comment on them, and make your own text or image post. I was the sole member responsible for the back-end, including converting plain HTML to Handlebars templates.
Back-end tools: Node.js, Express.js, Handlebars, MySQL/Sequelize. Front-end tools: jQuery, W3Schools CSS Framework

projects.title: IntelliDnD
description: A cross-platform web application that helps users manage their characters for the tabletop fantasy game, Dungeons & Dragons.
Started out as a Discord bot, now also a web application integrated with the same database so users can seamlessly use either platform.
Back-end tools: Discord.js API, MongoDB/Mongoose, Node.js, Express.js, Handlebars. Front-end tools: jQuery, Materialize CSS Framework
